Detailed Description

SimpleSemaphore object is a synchronization object that maintains a count between zero and a specified maximum value. The count is decremented each time a thread completes a wait for the semaphore object and incremented each time a thread releases the semaphore. When the count reaches zero, no more threads can successfully wait for the semaphore object state to become signaled. The state of a semaphore is set to signaled when its count is greater than zero, and non-signaled when its count is zero.

SimpleSemaphore is useful in controlling a shared resource that can support a limited number of users. It acts as a gate that limits the number of threads sharing the resource to a specified maximum number.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN SimpleSemaphore::Create (  INT  init_val = 0,
INT  max_val = -1
) 
 

Parameters:
init_val Specifies an initial count for the semaphore object. This value must be greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to max_val. The state of a semaphore is signaled when its count is greater than zero and non-signaled when it is zero. The count is decreased by one whenever a wait function releases a thread that was waiting for the semaphore. The count is increased by a specified amount by calling the Release method.
max_val Specifies the maximum count for the semaphore object. This value must be greater than zero.
Returns:
TRUE if succeeded. FALSE if failed.

BOOLEAN SimpleSemaphore::Create (  INT  init_val = 0,
INT  max_val = -1
) 
 

void SimpleSemaphore::Obtain (   ) 
 

Obtain returns when the specified object is in the signaled state.

void SimpleSemaphore::Obtain (   ) 
 

void SimpleSemaphore::Release (   ) 
 

Release increases the count of the semaphore object. If count exceeds max_val that was specified when the semaphore was created, the count is not changed.

void SimpleSemaphore::Release (   )
